Class CsvReader

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.io.CsvIo
com.dua3.utility.io.CsvReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public final class CsvReader extends CsvIo
A class that reads data from CSV files.

This class extends the CsvIo class and provides methods for reading CSV data from various sources.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    CsvReader.ListRowBuilder
    A CsvReader.RowBuilder implementation that creates a list of Strings for the cells contained in each row read.
    static interface 
    CsvReader.RowBuilder
    Interface used to build rows when reading CSV files.

  • Field Details

    • READ_COLUMN_NAMES

      public static final Option<Boolean> READ_COLUMN_NAMES
      A flag that determines whether the CSV reader should read column names from the CSV data.

      When set, the reader will attempt to parse and interpret the first row of the CSV file as column names.

    • IGNORE_EXCESSIVE_FIELDS

      public static final Option<Boolean> IGNORE_EXCESSIVE_FIELDS
      Specifies a flag to ignore excessive fields in CSV data during parsing. If enabled, fields beyond the expected number in a CSV row are ignored without raising an error. This is useful when dealing with unexpected data formats or when strict validation is not required.

    • IGNORE_MISSING_FIELDS

      public static final Option<Boolean> IGNORE_MISSING_FIELDS
      A flag indicating whether missing fields in the CSV data should be ignored during parsing. When this flag is set, missing fields in the CSV input will not raise errors or exceptions.

      This can be useful when dealing with files where some rows may have fewer fields than specified or expected.

  • Constructor Details

    • CsvReader

      public CsvReader(CsvReader.RowBuilder rowBuilder, BufferedReader reader, @Nullable URI source, Arguments options) throws IOException
      A utility class for reading CSV files.
      Parameters:
      rowBuilder - the row builder for creating CSV rows
      reader - the buffered reader for reading the CSV file
      source - the optional URI of the CSV file
      options - the arguments for configuring the CSV reader
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the CSV file

      public void close() throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getColumnName

      public String getColumnName(int columnNr)
      Get the column name.
      Parameters:
      columnNr - the column number
      Returns:
      name of column or columnNr as String if no name was set

    • getColumnNames

      public List<String> getColumnNames()
      Retrieves an unmodifiable list of column names defined for the CSV reader. If no column names were read, an empty list is returned.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List<String> of column names.

    • getIgnoreExcessFields

      public boolean getIgnoreExcessFields()
      Indicates whether excess fields in the CSV data should be ignored during parsing.
      Returns:
      true if excess fields are ignored; false otherwise

    • setIgnoreExcessFields

      public void setIgnoreExcessFields(boolean ignoreExcessFields)
      Configures whether excess fields in the CSV data should be ignored during parsing.
      Parameters:
      ignoreExcessFields - a boolean value indicating if excess fields should be ignored. If true, excess fields are ignored; if false, an exception or error may occur during parsing when excess fields are encountered.

    • getIgnoreMissingFields

      public boolean getIgnoreMissingFields()
      Indicates whether missing fields in the CSV data should be ignored during parsing.
      Returns:
      true if missing fields are ignored; false otherwise

    • setIgnoreMissingFields

      public void setIgnoreMissingFields(boolean ignoreMissingFields)
      Configures whether missing fields in the CSV data should be ignored during parsing.
      Parameters:
      ignoreMissingFields - a boolean value indicating if missing fields should be ignored. If true, missing fields are ignored; if false, an exception or error may occur during parsing when missing fields are encountered.

    • readSome

      public int readSome(int rowsToRead) throws IOException
      Read some rows of CSV data.
      Parameters:
      rowsToRead - number of rows to be read
      Returns:
      number of rows read
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during reading
      CsvFormatException - if the data read cannot be correctly interpreted

    • setColumnNames

      public void setColumnNames(List<String> columnNames)
      Sets the column names for the CSV reader.
      Parameters:
      columnNames - the list of column names to be used
